MORNING WATCH
OPERATIONS
LIEUTENANT	(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)	DAY WATCH
OPERATIONS
LIEUTENANT	(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)	EVENING WATCH
OPERATIONS
LIEUTENANT	(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. These observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT ___________________
CAPTAIN ___________________
DOJ-OGR-00026423

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. These observations must be documented.

REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT ___________________
CAPTAIN ___________________

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries and redactions. The document is a 30-minute check sheet for inmates in a special housing unit.
